==Chinese==

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|疒|嵒|ls=psc|c1=s|c2=p}}; {{l|zh|嵒}} is a variant of {{l|zh|岩}}.

===Etymology===
From {{zh-l|岩|cliff; rock, stone}}, since cancers often present as lumps or outgrowths on the body.

In Mandarin, this character used to be pronounced identically as {{zh-l|岩}}. Its pronunciation was changed to ''ái'' in the 1960s to avoid the homophony between {{zh-l|癌|cancer}} and {{zh-l|炎|inflammation}} (compare {{zh-l|肺炎|pneumonia}} and {{zh-l|肺癌|lung cancer}}). The new pronunciation of ''ái'' stems from dialectal pronunciations of {{zh-l|*岩|rock; cliff}} {{IPAchar|/ŋai/}}, influenced by {{zh-l|崖|tr=yá, yái|cliff}}.
